articles.headline: In Win for Environmentalists, Senate Keeps an Obama-Era Climate Change Rule
articles.snippet: Senators voted 51 to 49 to block a measure that would have undone a regulation to control the release of methane from oil and gas wells on public land.
articles.abstract: Senators voted 51 to 49 to block a measure that would have undone a regulation to control the release of methane from oil and gas wells on public land.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In a surprising victory for President Barack Obama’s environmental legacy, the Senate voted on Wednesday to uphold an Obama-era climate change regulation to control the release of methane from oil and gas wells on public land.

articles.headline: Whole Foods, Pressured by Restless Investors, Shakes Up Board
articles.snippet: The upscale grocer named Gabrielle Sulzberger as its new chairwoman and replaced five directors amid a push for changes by the hedge fund Jana Partners and other restless shareholders.
articles.abstract: The upscale grocer named Gabrielle Sulzberger as its new chairwoman and replaced five directors amid a push for changes by the hedge fund Jana Partners and other restless shareholders.
articles.lead_paragraph: John Mackey, a founder of Whole Foods Market, took the helm as sole chief executive last year in a bid to single-handedly revive the upscale grocer’s fortunes.

articles.headline: ‘Enough Was Enough’: How Festering Anger at Comey Ended in His Firing
articles.snippet: President Trump returned from a weekend away determined to act after months of growing frustration with the F.B.I. director, according to people close to the president.
articles.abstract: President Trump returned from a weekend away determined to act after months of growing frustration with the F.B.I. director, according to people close to the president.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — By the end, neither of them thought much of the other.
articles.byline: By Maggie Haberman, Glenn Thrush, Michael S. Schmidt and Peter Baker

articles.headline: Snap’s $2.2 Billion Loss Caps Bumpy First Months as a Public Company
articles.snippet: The parent of the messaging app Snapchat reported earnings that missed Wall Street expectations in almost every regard.
articles.abstract: The parent of the messaging app Snapchat reported earnings that missed Wall Street expectations in almost every regard.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — When Snap listed its shares on the New York Stock Exchange in March, the floor of the exchange was festooned in the company’s signature yellow. Family members of Snap executives posed for photographs; some wore the company’s video-recording Spectacles. And as Snap’s two 20-something founders rang the opening bell, the crowd — including one of the founder’s fathers and a supermodel fiancée — applauded.

articles.headline: ‘Brexit’ Imperils London’s Claim as Banker to the Planet
articles.snippet: Britain’s abandonment of the European Union jeopardizes London’s status as the leading hub of international finance.
articles.abstract: Britain’s abandonment of the European Union jeopardizes London’s status as the leading hub of international finance.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — From a skyscraper in Canary Wharf, the once-bustling cluster of docks transformed into a global banking center, traders at Citigroup’s regional headquarters move unfathomable sums of money around the planet. They are exploiting London’s unrivaled connections to the intricate plumbing of the international financial system.

articles.headline: Steel Industry, Seeing a New Dawn, Is Cheering for Trump
articles.snippet: Stocks are up, and employees at a South Carolina plant are confident in the prospect of infrastructure spending and a tough stand on trade.
articles.abstract: Stocks are up, and employees at a South Carolina plant are confident in the prospect of infrastructure spending and a tough stand on trade.
articles.lead_paragraph: HUGER, S.C. — Safely stationed in the control pulpit, Chris St. Amand is watching the pot boil.

articles.headline: When the Wife of a Soldier Hears a Knock at the Door
articles.snippet: After Staff Sgt. Mark De Alencar’s death in America’s forgotten war in Afghanistan last month, his family finds solace in sharing with the nation a man his wife calls “my hero in our little world.”
articles.abstract: After Staff Sgt. Mark De Alencar’s death in America’s forgotten war in Afghanistan last month, his family finds solace in sharing with the nation a man his wife calls “my hero in our little world.”
articles.lead_paragraph: ARLINGTON, Va. — Before Staff Sgt. Mark De Alencar shipped out to Afghanistan in February, he planned a family homecoming for his scheduled return in May.
